heading: 22.1 Even Odd Schedule
text:
Bioconductor ‘devel’ branch new features introduced,
release branches created twice per year. Given package 
version number x.y.z,y odd number devel.y even number release.regular development new featuresAuthors increment z version package ‘devel’
branch 1 GIT commit, e.g., 1.1.0 1.1.1, 1.1.2,
…, 1.1.10, 1.1.11Any bug fixes ported release branch similarly
incremented, 1.0.1, 1.0.2, …Changes made GIT without corresponding version bump 
propagate repository visible BiocManager::install().time release, Bioconductor team arranges :Create release branch package version: x . (y+1) . (z-z)Increment devel branch package version : x . (y+2) . (z-z)special case, package version x.99.z bumped 
(x+1) . 0 . (z-z) release, (x+1) . 1 . 0 devel.
Thus authors wishing signify major change package set y
99 devel package.

case results version 1.0.0.See additional details Package Submission page.See also instructions Using Bioc Devel.

heading: 23.1 How and when does the BBS pull? When will my changes propagate?
text:
Please remember daily builder pulls, installs, builds, checks package
per day. process starts around 2:30 PM (14:30) EST everyday
(.e., UTC−05:00).
Changes pushed Bioconductor 2:30 reflected following
day’s build report posted around 11:30 EST. build report 
time stamp top page generated. Changes 
2:30 PM EST reflect day tomorrow, therefore
possibly taking 36-48 hours. build reports 
devel release show
package version commit id reflected build.
landing pages packages (e.g.,
Biobase)
updated package installs/build/checks without ERROR; 
propagate broken packages. account different version 
landing page pushed Bioconductor. Please also remember 
package ALWAYS needs valid version bump propagate users.schedule software, data experiment, annotation, books, workflows can 
found check results page. 
order changes included report, changes committed 
Bioconductor git.bioconductor.org location morning listed day
valid version bump.

heading: 23.4.8 Grid package changes
text:
lot specifics changed notified 
email. Important sections email follows:
code:
I am about to commit some internal changes to 'grid' units
        (for, in some cases, 100x speed-up of unit operations).
        A number of packages have already been fixed to work with these
        changes, but, according to my testing, the following CRAN
        packages will still fail R CMD check.
    Some of those are cascades ('armada', 'countToFPKM', and 'wilson'
        from 'ComplexHeatmap' - see below - and 'fingertipscharts' from 'lemon'
        and 'xpose' is actually a 'ggforce' problem), but all of the other
        package authors have been notified and several are already working on
        fixes.
        The most serious of those is 'ComplexHeatmap' because it causes multiple
        follow-on failures, the CRAN ones above and others on BioConductor:
    Again, the main package authors have been notified and the
    'ComplexHeatmap' author is working on an update.

heading: 23.4.9 plot generic moved
text:
plot generic moved graphics base. ERROR’s seen 
change non specific can take many forms. ERROR’s see
areorThe explanation given:
code:
Error in getGeneric(f, TRUE, envir, package) :
 no generic function found for 'plot'Error in as.double(y) :
      cannot coerce type 'S4' to vector of type 'double'
  “The namespace controls the search strategy for variables used by
  functions in the package. If not found locally, R searches the package
  namespace first, then the imports, then the base namespace and then  the
  normal search path." as per
  https://cran.r-project.org/doc/manuals/r-devel/R-exts.html#Package-namespaces):

  CRAN and Bioconductor  had a few packages that "worked" because the right
  plot() was found in the normal search path, but now fail because it's
  calling the one in base instead.

heading: 23.4.10 Partial Argument Matching
text:
now strict checking argument matching regards partial
argument matching. Best described following exampleNotice generic uses breaks setMethod uses break; 
example partial argument match longer valid.Partial argument matching envoking functions also avoided
